version.doc: Style specification version number. Must be 8.

name.doc: A human-readable name for the style.

metadata.doc: Arbitrary properties useful to track with the stylesheet, but do not influence rendering. Properties should be prefixed to avoid collisions, like 'mapbox:'.

center.doc: Default map center in longitude and latitude.  The style center will be used only if the map has not been positioned by other means (e.g. map options or user interaction).

zoom.doc: Default zoom level.  The style zoom will be used only if the map has not been positioned by other means (e.g. map options or user interaction).

bearing.doc: Default bearing, in degrees clockwise from true north.  The style bearing will be used only if the map has not been positioned by other means (e.g. map options or user interaction).

pitch.doc: Default pitch, in degrees. Zero is perpendicular to the surface, for a look straight down at the map, while a greater value like 60 looks ahead towards the horizon. The style pitch will be used only if the map has not been positioned by other means (e.g. map options or user interaction).

sprite.doc: A base URL for retrieving the sprite image and metadata. The extensions `.png`, `.json` and scale factor `@2x.png` will be automatically appended. This property is required if any layer uses the 'sprite-image' layout property.

glyphs.doc: A URL template for loading signed-distance-field glyph sets in PBF format. The URL must include `{fontstack}` and `{range}` tokens. This property is required if any layer uses the 'text-field' layout property.

transition.doc: A global transition definition to use as a default across properties.

layers.doc: Layers will be drawn in the order of this array.

*.doc: Specification of a data source. For vector and raster sources, either TileJSON or a URL to a TileJSON must be provided. For GeoJSON and video sources, a URL must be provided.

type.doc: The data type of the tile source.

url.doc: A URL to a TileJSON resource. Supported protocols are `http:`, `https:`, and `mapbox://<mapid>`.

tiles.doc: An array of one or more tile source URLs, as in the TileJSON spec.

minzoom.doc: Minimum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec.

maxzoom.doc: Maximum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec. Data from tiles at the maxzoom are used when displaying the map at higher zoom levels.

tileSize.doc: The minimum visual size to display tiles for this layer. Only configurable for raster layers.

*.doc: Other keys to configure the data source.

type.doc: The data type of the GeoJSON source.

data.doc: A URL to a GeoJSON file, or inline GeoJSON.

maxzoom.doc: Maximum zoom level at which to create vector tiles (higher means greater detail at high zoom levels).

buffer.doc: Size of the tile buffer on each side. A value of 0 produces no buffer. A value of 512 produces a buffer as wide as the tile itself. Larger values produce fewer rendering artifacts near tile edges and slower performance.

tolerance.doc: Douglas-Peucker simplification tolerance (higher means simpler geometries and faster performance).

cluster.doc: If the data is a collection of point features, setting this to true clusters the points by radius into groups.

clusterRadius.doc: Radius of each cluster if clustering is enabled. A value of 512 indicates a radius equal to the width of a tile.

clusterMaxZoom.doc: Max zoom on which to cluster points if clustering is enabled. Defaults to one zoom less than maxzoom (so that last zoom features are not clustered).

type.doc: The data type of the video source.

urls.doc: URLs to video content in order of preferred format.

coordinates.doc: Corners of video specified in longitude, latitude pairs.

type.doc: The data type of the image source.

url.doc: URL that points to an image

coordinates.doc: Corners of image specified in longitude, latitude pairs.

fill.doc: A filled polygon with an optional stroked border.

symbol.doc: An icon or a text label.

raster.doc: Raster map textures such as satellite imagery.

background.doc: The background color or pattern of the map.

metadata.doc: Arbitrary properties useful to track with the layer, but do not influence rendering. Properties should be prefixed to avoid collisions, like 'mapbox:'.

ref.doc: References another layer to copy `type`, `source`, `source-layer`, `minzoom`, `maxzoom`, `filter`, and `layout` properties from. This allows the layers to share processing and be more efficient.

source.doc: Name of a source description to be used for this layer.

source-layer.doc: Layer to use from a vector tile source. Required if the source supports multiple layers.

minzoom.doc: The minimum zoom level on which the layer gets parsed and appears on.

maxzoom.doc: The maximum zoom level on which the layer gets parsed and appears on.

interactive.doc: Enable querying of feature data from this layer for interactivity.

filter.doc: A expression specifying conditions on source features. Only features that match the filter are displayed.

paint.doc: Default paint properties for this layer.

paint.*.doc: Class-specific paint properties for this layer. The class name is the part after the first dot.

butt.doc: A cap with a squared-off end which is drawn to the exact endpoint of the line.

round.doc: A cap with a rounded end which is drawn beyond the endpoint of the line at a radius of one-half of the line's width and centered on the endpoint of the line.

square.doc: A cap with a squared-off end which is drawn beyond the endpoint of the line at a distance of one-half of the line's width.

bevel.doc: A join with a squared-off end which is drawn beyond the endpoint of the line at a distance of one-half of the line's width.

round.doc: A join with a rounded end which is drawn beyond the endpoint of the line at a radius of one-half of the line's width and centered on the endpoint of the line.

miter.doc: A join with a sharp, angled corner which is drawn with the outer sides beyond the endpoint of the path until they meet.

line-join.doc: The display of lines when joining.

line-miter-limit.doc: Used to automatically convert miter joins to bevel joins for sharp angles.

line-round-limit.doc: Used to automatically convert round joins to miter joins for shallow angles.

point.doc: The label is placed at the point where the geometry is located.

line.doc: The label is placed along the line of the geometry. Can only be used on `LineStrings` and `Polygons`.

symbol-placement.doc: Label placement relative to its geometry.

symbol-avoid-edges.doc: If true, the symbols will not cross tile edges to avoid mutual collisions. Recommended in layers that don't have enough padding in the vector tile to prevent collisions, or if it is a point symbol layer placed after a line symbol layer.

icon-allow-overlap.doc: If true, the icon will be visible even if it collides with other previously drawn symbols.

icon-ignore-placement.doc: If true, other symbols can be visible even if they collide with the icon.

icon-optional.doc: If true, text will display without their corresponding icons when the icon collides with other symbols and the text does not.

map.doc: When `symbol-placement` is set to `point`, produces icons whose x-axes are aligned east-west. When `symbol-placement` is set to `line`, produces icons whose x-axes are aligned with the line.

viewport.doc: Produces icons whose x-axes are aligned with the x-axis of the viewport, regardless of the value of `symbol-placement`.

auto.doc: When `symbol-placement` is set to `point`, this is equivalent to `viewport`. When `symbol-placement` is set to `line`, this is equivalent to `map`.

icon-rotation-alignment.doc: In combination with `symbol-placement`, determines the rotation behavior of icons.

icon-size.doc: Scale factor for icon. 1 is original size, 3 triples the size.

both.doc: Scaling is done in both x- and y-dimensions.

width.doc: Scaling is done in the x-dimension to fit the text's dimensions.

height.doc: Scaling is done in the y-dimension to fit the text's dimensions.

icon-text-fit.doc: Scales the icon to fit around the associated text.

icon-text-fit-padding.doc: Size of the additional area added to dimensions determined by `icon-text-fix`, in clockwise order: top, right, bottom, left.

icon-image.doc: A string with {tokens} replaced, referencing the data property to pull from.

icon-padding.doc: Size of the additional area around the icon bounding box used for detecting symbol collisions.

icon-keep-upright.doc: If true, the icon may be flipped to prevent it from being rendered upside-down.

icon-offset.doc: Offset distance of icon from its anchor. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up.

map.doc: The text is aligned to the plane of the map.

viewport.doc: The text is aligned to the plane of the viewport.

text-pitch-alignment.doc: Orientation of text when map is pitched.

map.doc: When `symbol-placement` is set to `point`, produces glyphs whose x-axes are aligned east-west. When `symbol-placement` is set to `line`, produces glyphs whose x-axes are aligned with the line.

viewport.doc: Produces glyphs whose x-axes are aligned with the x-axis of the viewport, regardless of the value of `symbol-placement`.

auto.doc: When `symbol-placement` is set to `point`, this is equivalent to `viewport`. When `symbol-placement` is set to `line`, this is equivalent to `map`.

text-rotation-alignment.doc: In combination with `symbol-placement`, determines the rotation behavior of the individual glyphs forming the text.

text-field.doc: Value to use for a text label. Feature properties are specified using tokens like {field_name}.

text-font.doc: Font stack to use for displaying text.

text-max-width.doc: The maximum line width for text wrapping.

text-line-height.doc: Text leading value for multi-line text.

left.doc: The text is aligned to the left.

right.doc: The text is aligned to the right.

center.doc: The center of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

left.doc: The left side of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

right.doc: The right side of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

top.doc: The top of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

bottom.doc: The bottom of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

top-left.doc: The top left corner of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

top-right.doc: The top right corner of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

bottom-left.doc: The bottom left corner of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

bottom-right.doc: The bottom right corner of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

text-anchor.doc: Part of the text placed closest to the anchor.

text-max-angle.doc: Maximum angle change between adjacent characters.

text-padding.doc: Size of the additional area around the text bounding box used for detecting symbol collisions.

text-keep-upright.doc: If true, the text may be flipped vertically to prevent it from being rendered upside-down.

uppercase.doc: Forces all letters to be displayed in uppercase.

lowercase.doc: Forces all letters to be displayed in lowercase.

text-transform.doc: Specifies how to capitalize text, similar to the CSS `text-transform` property.

text-offset.doc: Offset distance of text from its anchor. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up.

text-allow-overlap.doc: If true, the text will be visible even if it collides with other previously drawn symbols.

text-ignore-placement.doc: If true, other symbols can be visible even if they collide with the text.

text-optional.doc: If true, icons will display without their corresponding text when the text collides with other symbols and the icon does not.

filter.doc: A filter selects specific features from a layer.

>=.doc: The greater than or equal operator.

<=.doc: The less than or equal operator.

geometry_type.doc: The geometry type for the filter to select.

base.doc: The exponential base of the interpolation curve. It controls the rate at which the result increases. Higher values make the result increase more towards the high end of the range. With `1` the stops are interpolated linearly.

property.doc: The name of a global property or feature property to use as the function input.

type.doc: The interpolation strategy to use in function evaluation.

fill-antialias.doc: Whether or not the fill should be antialiased.

fill-opacity.doc: The opacity of the entire fill layer. In contrast to the `fill-color`, this value will also affect the 1px stroke around the fill, if the stroke is used.

fill-color.doc: The color of the filled part of this layer. This color can be specified as `rgba` with an alpha component and the color's opacity will not affect the opacity of the 1px stroke, if it is used.

fill-outline-color.doc: The outline color of the fill. Matches the value of `fill-color` if unspecified.

fill-translate.doc: The geometry's offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

map.doc: The fill is translated relative to the map.

viewport.doc: The fill is translated relative to the viewport.

fill-pattern.doc: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing image fills. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, ..., 512).

line-opacity.doc: The opacity at which the line will be drawn.

line-color.doc: The color with which the line will be drawn.

line-translate.doc: The geometry's offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

map.doc: The line is translated relative to the map.

viewport.doc: The line is translated relative to the viewport.

line-gap-width.doc: Draws a line casing outside of a line's actual path. Value indicates the width of the inner gap.

line-offset.doc: The line's offset. For linear features, a positive value offsets the line to the right, relative to the direction of the line, and a negative value to the left. For polygon features, a positive value results in an inset, and a negative value results in an outset.

line-blur.doc: Blur applied to the line, in pixels.

line-dasharray.doc: Specifies the lengths of the alternating dashes and gaps that form the dash pattern. The lengths are later scaled by the line width. To convert a dash length to pixels, multiply the length by the current line width.

line-pattern.doc: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing image lines. For seamless patterns, image width must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, ..., 512).

circle-color.doc: The fill color of the circle.

circle-blur.doc: Amount to blur the circle. 1 blurs the circle such that only the centerpoint is full opacity.

circle-opacity.doc: The opacity at which the circle will be drawn.

circle-translate.doc: The geometry's offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

map.doc: The circle is translated relative to the map.

viewport.doc: The circle is translated relative to the viewport.

map.doc: Circles are scaled according to their apparent distance to the camera.

circle-pitch-scale.doc: Controls the scaling behavior of the circle when the map is pitched.

icon-opacity.doc: The opacity at which the icon will be drawn.

icon-color.doc: The color of the icon. This can only be used with sdf icons.

icon-halo-color.doc: The color of the icon's halo. Icon halos can only be used with SDF icons.

icon-halo-width.doc: Distance of halo to the icon outline.

icon-halo-blur.doc: Fade out the halo towards the outside.

icon-translate.doc: Distance that the icon's anchor is moved from its original placement. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up.

map.doc: Icons are translated relative to the map.

viewport.doc: Icons are translated relative to the viewport.

text-opacity.doc: The opacity at which the text will be drawn.

text-color.doc: The color with which the text will be drawn.

text-halo-color.doc: The color of the text's halo, which helps it stand out from backgrounds.

text-halo-width.doc: Distance of halo to the font outline. Max text halo width is 1/4 of the font-size.

text-halo-blur.doc: The halo's fadeout distance towards the outside.

text-translate.doc: Distance that the text's anchor is moved from its original placement. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up.

map.doc: The text is translated relative to the map.

viewport.doc: The text is translated relative to the viewport.

raster-opacity.doc: The opacity at which the image will be drawn.

raster-hue-rotate.doc: Rotates hues around the color wheel.

raster-brightness-min.doc: Increase or reduce the brightness of the image. The value is the minimum brightness.

raster-brightness-max.doc: Increase or reduce the brightness of the image. The value is the maximum brightness.

raster-saturation.doc: Increase or reduce the saturation of the image.

raster-contrast.doc: Increase or reduce the contrast of the image.

raster-fade-duration.doc: Fade duration when a new tile is added.

background-color.doc: The color with which the background will be drawn.

background-pattern.doc: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing an image background. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, ..., 512).

background-opacity.doc: The opacity at which the background will be drawn.

duration.doc: Time allotted for transitions to complete.

delay.doc: Length of time before a transition begins.
